titles.title: DOE and SBA Research Act
DOE and SBA Research Act
DOE and SBA Research Act
DOE and SBA Research Act
To provide for Department of Energy and Small Business Administration joint research and development activities, and for other purposes.
To provide for Department of Energy, National Laboratories, and Small Business Administration joint research and development activities, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, and in addition to the Committee on Small Business, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, and in addition to the Committee on Small Business, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 26 - 0.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Reported by the Committee on Small Business. H. Rept. 118-183, Part I.
Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4669.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: House Small Business
committee.activity: Bills Of Interest - Exchange Of Letters, Reported By, Markup By, Referred To

bill.summary:
DOE and SBA Research Act
This bill requires the Department of Energy and the Small Business Administration to enter into an agreement to collaborate on research and development activities.
The agencies must report on any collaborative research achievements and potential opportunities to expand the technical capabilities of the agencies.
